instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115B: What is 820-3115B? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: does not recognize hard drive , question mark <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
I tested with a good operating system and hard drive good, persist problem
these are tests that I have done
I have tried another hard drive flex cable, problem persists
l4500 5v present
j4501pin 1,2,5,7,9,11 present 5V

threads.title: does not recognize hard drive , question mark <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Any history fault?
Boot with USB macOS and check if HDD appears in Disk Utility.
Discard an APFS issue...

threads.title: does not recognize hard drive , question mark <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: hard drive usb mac os catalina and internal is recognized in disk utilities apperars in afps format, also I tested with internal hard drive hiigh sierra  and it starts well without question mark folder

threads.title: does not recognize hard drive , question mark <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Not easy to understand your reply.

Is the machine working good now, with other internal HDD?

threads.title: does not recognize hard drive , question mark <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: yes with high sierra format mac os plus, but it does not work afps catalina

threads.title: does not recognize hard drive , question mark <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
To make it work with APFS, need to update BIOS.
Take an empty HDD/SSD and do a fresh install of High Sierra, or Mojave.
Then put back the other HDD.
Maybe need a bit of tweak to accept Catalina.

threads.title: does not recognize hard drive , question mark <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115B</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
